sentence.Network_en: He made one mistake and his career came to an ignominious end.
sentence.Network_cn: 他犯了一个错误，他的事业就很不体面地结束了。

sentence.Network_en: The marriage was considered especially ignominious since she was of royal descent.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于她出身王族,这门婚事被认为是奇耻大辱.

sentence.Network_en: The UN were faced with an ignominious withdrawal or a long - term military presence.
sentence.Network_cn: 联合国要么选择不光彩地撤军,要么选择维持 长期 的驻军.

the industry also played an ignominious cameo in second hearing , on AAA-rated investments peddled by Goldman Sachs that subsequently bombed .这个行业在第二次听证会中也扮演了可耻的角色，由高盛公司兜售的AAA级投资品随后便惨败。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French ignominieux, or Latin ignominiosus, from ignominia (see ignominy)

entry.tran: 耻辱的;不光彩的;不名誉的;丢脸的
entry.def: If you describe an experience or action as ignominious, you mean it is embarrassing because it shows a great lack of success.

example.ex: Many thought that he was doomed to ignominious failure.
example.tran: 许多人认为他注定会极不光彩地失败。

means.word_mean: 1. (used of conduct or character) deserving or bringing disgrace or shame;

sentences.sentence: "Man...has written one of his blackest records as a destroyer on the oceanic islands"- Rachel Carson

stems_affixes.word_buile: cog同+nomin名称,名字+al……的→adj.同名的,同姓的
ig不+nomin名称,名字+ious……的→不好的名字→可耻的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 名义上的;[金额,租金]微不足道的
stems_affixes.word_buile: nomin名称,名字+al表形容词→adj.名义上的;[金额,租金]微不足道的
denominate[v.命名,取名]+ion表名词→n.命名,[长度,币值的]单位
ig不+nomin名称,名字+y状态→不好的名字→可耻
nomin名称,名字+ee被动的人→被提名的人
de给予+nomin名称,名字+ate表动词→给予名称
nomin名称,名字+ate表动词→v.提名,任命
